meanings.definition: In a paltry or insignificant manner.
meanings.sent1: She completed the task paltrily, barely putting in any effort.
meanings.sent2: The old house was paltrily decorated with cheap furniture.
meanings.sent3: He paltrily attempted to juggle oranges but ended up dropping them all.
meanings.sent4: The stars shone paltrily in the cloudy night sky.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's praise fell paltrily on the student's ears, lacking sincerity.

meanings.sent1: The paltrily wrapped gift was quickly forgotten by the recipient.
meanings.sent2: She refused to wear the paltrily designed necklace to the party.
meanings.sent3: The paltrily written note was barely legible due to the smudged ink.
meanings.sent4: His paltrily made excuses did not convince anyone of his innocence.
meanings.sent5: The paltrily attended event had very few guests and lacked excitement.
